metadata.subject: Fwd: White House exploring VAT (Washington Post)

organizations: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Incorporated
locations: One Bryant Park, 5th Floor, New York, NY 10036

relationships.description: Richard Kahn is forwarding market analysis to Jeffrey E.
Amanda Ens is a director at Bank of America Merrill Lynch providing market analysis to Richard Kahn
David Woo sent market analysis to Amanda Ens

analysis.purpose: To share market analysis and Washington Post article about potential tax policy changes with Jeffrey E.
analysis.significance: Shows financial professionals sharing policy analysis and market insights with Jeffrey Epstein

notable_quotes: A VAT has all the virtues of a BAT without any of its drawbacks
This news is bullish for Trump trades, at least for the medium-term
The search for new options reflects a recognition of the political challenges facing a proposal known as a border-adjustment tax

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present

illegal_activity.description: Document contains forwarded news article and market analysis about tax policy - no first-hand illegal activity

details: Washington Post article by Damian Paletta and Max Ehrenfreund about White House tax policy considerations

public_knowledge.context: Tax policy discussions during early Trump administration were widely covered in financial and political media

analysis.summary: Richard Kahn forwards a Washington Post article and market analysis from Bank of America Merrill Lynch about the White House considering value-added and carbon taxes as part of tax reform, with the analyst viewing this development as bullish for Trump-related trades in the medium term.
